cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to move northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas–Louisiana border mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border, close to Port Arthur–Cameron area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts from Galveston Bay eastward to Intracoastal City
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (48%) of sustained 34-kt winds with a 22% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible at landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential life-threatening surge exceeding 3 ft possible along the upper TX coast including Sabine Pass/Port Arthur as the storm nears Category-strength.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches with isolated 15 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous seas and swells, possible tornadoes in outer rain bands, and prolonged port closure/disruption.
